intro: Miconia mantuensis, commonly known as the mantuensis miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences that produce small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
